questions.question: Who is the author of 'The Two Gentlemen of Verona'?
questions.answer: William Shakespeare

questions.question: Who are the two gentlemen in the lesson?
questions.answer: Two brothers

questions.question: What are the names of the two brothers?
questions.answer: Nicola and Jacopo

questions.question: Why do the boys work hard?
questions.answer: To help their sister

questions.question: Where is their sister Lucia kept?
questions.answer: In a hospital

questions.question: What qualities of the boys are highlighted?
questions.answer: Sacrifice and devotion

questions.question: How do the boys earn money?

options.text: Selling newspapers and doing odd jobs

questions.answer: Selling newspapers and doing odd jobs

questions.question: What is the central theme of the story?
questions.answer: Sacrifice and love

questions.question: Why do the boys refuse help?
questions.answer: Self-respect

questions.question: What lesson does the story teach?
questions.answer: Power of love and sacrifice

questions.question: Who were Nicola and Jacopo?
questions.answer: They were two young brothers from Verona who worked hard to help their sister.

questions.question: Why did the boys work day and night?
questions.answer: They worked to earn money for their sister’s medical treatment.

questions.question: What qualities of the boys impressed the narrator?
questions.answer: Their devotion, self-respect, and sacrifice impressed the narrator.

questions.question: Why did the boys refuse help from the narrator?
questions.answer: They had self-respect and wanted to earn honestly.

questions.question: What message does the story give?
questions.answer: True love and sacrifice can overcome hardships.
